intro: Pyrularia edulis, commonly known as the edible pyrularia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into round, fleshy fruits containing edible seeds. These seeds are rich in nutrients and have been traditionally used by indigenous communities for food and medicinal purposes. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
